channel.title: Green Ruby
channel.description: Green Ruby News is a feed of fresh links of the week about ruby, javascript, webdev, devops, collected by mose every sunday

item.title: Green Ruby News #207
item.content:encoded:
#207 - jan 22nd 2017

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Vermont
Nice site from a Czech marketing firm.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
All Ruby Books
A great collection of ruby books.
Top Pens of 2016 on CodePen
100 top pens.
Big List of Naughty Strings
List of strings which have a high probability of causing issues when used as user-input data.
Webminal
Learn and Practise Linux online.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Google Assistant Ruby
Write Google Assistant actions in Ruby.
Gitscout
Gitscout is a beautiful GitHub Issues experience for macOS
LicenseFinder
Find licenses for your project's dependencies.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Part 1: Mock microservices to speedup development jan 16
In order to tests integrations, we generally mock external services.
Is Ruby dead? Hell no! - Analyzing RubyGems stats for 2016 jan 17
Rails downloads are still increasing.
Caching at Reddit jan 17
How Reddit monitor, tune, and scale our memcached infrastructure.
Ruby's Mysterious Triple Equals Operator, a.k.a. Case Equality Operator jan 18
Instead of testing equality, it tests inclusion.
Rescue exceptions DSL for plain Ruby objects with Rails jan 19
Rescue exceptions like Rails controllers.
Run a Local Rails Script on Heroku jan 18
In this post, I’ll show you how to execute a long Ruby/Rails script in a remote Heroku environment.
Some universal code optimization rules jan 19
From time to time I have advocated for design approaches which value consistency and ease of change over raw operations per second.
Short guide to awesome changelogs jan 19
Usage of the git-changelog npm package.
How To Test Ruby CLI: The Setup jan 20
One of the most difficult tasks I met during Hanami development is to write integration tests for the Command Line Interface (CLI).
Auto-reconnect for ActiveRecord connections jan 20
Often we want to have more control over the reconnect strategy in order to give it more than one chance for the connection to recover.

item.title: Green Ruby News #206
item.content:encoded:
#206 - jan 15th 2017

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
The Most Hearted of 2016
These are the most hearted Pens of 2016.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Segment
Collect all of your customer data and send it anywhere.
clean-code-javascript
A guide to producing readable, reusable, and refactorable software in JavaScript.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
ActForm
Create form object easily with activemodel >= 5.
Pandas
Flexible and powerful data analysis / manipulation library for Python.
Invisible_captcha
Unobtrusive and flexible spam protection for RoR apps.
Terjira
An interactive CLI tool for Jira.
Alacritty
A cross-platform, GPU-accelerated terminal emulator.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
State of the 2017 Rails Stack jan 9
Are folks upgrading to Rails 5? Where is the Postgres vs. MySQL battle heading? Are devs embracing Puma and concurrency?
From Rails to Hanami: Models jan 9
Hanami is a MVC web framework for Ruby that prioritize the use of plain objects over magical classes with too much responsibility.
Do the Right Thing and Document Your Rails API with Swagger jan 9
Learn how to use swagger to document APIs.
Rescue's Elegant Trick for Knowing Which Exceptions to Catch jan 10
Example of how a seemingly-trivial implementation detail like using === instead of kind_of? makes Ruby much more flexible and interesting.
Fantastic Flow Arrows for Sketch jan 10
This tutorial shows you how to make scalable, dynamic flow arrows for your UX flow charts and explainers.
How requirements shaped my code, AKA Rails 5 and ActiveRecord before_destroy callbacks jan 12
Model callbacks in Rails 5 has some gotcha, here is one in before_destroy.
initial-letter jan 12
initial-letter is a CSS property that selects the first letter of the element where it is applied and specifies the number of lines the letter occupies.

item.title: Green Ruby News #205
item.content:encoded:
#205 - jan 8th 2017

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Obrigado
good design and horizontal scrolling.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Rails-security-checklist
Community-driven Rails Security Checklist.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Pp_sql
Rails ActiveRecord SQL queries log beautifier.
Activerecord-multi-tenant
Rails/ActiveRecord support for distributed multi-tenant databases like Postgres+Citus.
Field_test
A/B testing tool for Rails.
Winds
RSS reader with some machine learning.
Git-crecord
Git subcommand to interactively select changes to commit or stage.
Kite
Micro-service framework in Go.
Zazu
An extensible and open source launcher.
Git Fork
Yet another Git client for Mac.
Wappalyzer
Cross-platform utility that uncovers the technologies used on websites.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Common Rails Idioms that Kill Database Performance jan 3
Beware of some common yet dangerous usage of ActiveRecord query.
How To Spy on Your Ruby Methods jan 4
Use TracePoint class to spy on your code.
Functions as a Service (FaaS) jan 4
Learn about a new proof of concept called Functions as a Service FaaS which brings Serverless to Docker Swarm Mode using brand new 1.13 features.
Design for internationalization jan 4
Build better products for people around the world.
Realm Is The Ultimate Android Mobile Database Solution jan 6
Efficient database solution for mobile platforms, turned out to be an amazing replacement for SQLite on Android.

item.title: Green Ruby News #204
item.content:encoded:
#204 - jan 1st 2017

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Valerian
A movie website with some game and crazy effects (and made with rails).

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
ReactiveX
An API for asynchronous programming with observable streams
Awesomo
The really big list of really interesting open source projects in various languages.
Stack-on-a-budget
A collection of services with great free tiers for developers on a budget.
Google-interview-university
A complete daily plan for studying to become a Google software engineer.
Alerta
Alerts management.
Remote Stories
Anonymous stories from remote workers

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
PluckAll
Pluck multiple attributes in Rails 3, 4, 5, and can return data as hash instead of only array.
AppPerf
This is a application monitoring app. I am trying to build an open source, easy to setup, performance monitoring tool.
BetterSJR
BetterSJR improves server-generated JavaScript (SJR) responses in Rails by adding error messages for debugging.
File replicator, a split-join command line tool
This Gem provides you with two command line tools, one to split up files and one to join them back togather again.
Wannabe Bool
If string, numeric, symbol and nil values wanna be a boolean value, they can with the new to_b method.
MakeModelSearchable
Moduler solution to add search functionality for selected fields.
TTY::Color
Terminal color capabilities detection.
Pastel
Terminal output styling with intuitive and clean API that doesn't monkey patch String class.
i18n-tasks
i18n-tasks helps you find and manage missing and unused translations.
rbnacl
Ruby binding to the Networking and Cryptography (NaCl) library.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Primitive obsession dec 26
Primitive Obsession is using primitive data types to represent domain ideas.
A Guide to 2017 Conferences dec 26
Many great talks and conferences happening in our industry in 2017.
Isolate Global State dec 27
Using global state in software programs, is handy for development, but evil to maintain.
Creating Advanced Active Record DB Queries with Arel dec 28
Arel is an excellent AST to get you quickly building even the most complicated queries.
The 15 most popular Ruby links of 2016 dec 29
We’ve delved into all the data from Ruby Weekly and found the most popular links of the year.

item.title: Green Ruby News #203
item.content:encoded:
#203 - dec 25th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
HiveBoxx
Simple but elegant product presentation.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
AnyChart
JavaScript/HTML5 Chart library for any project.
JSON schema faker
JSON fake data generator.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
database_cleaner
Strategies for cleaning databases in Ruby.
json-server
Fake JSON REST API in 30 seconds.
PEV
Postgres Explain Visualizer.
Money
A Ruby Library for dealing with money and currency conversion.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
How the F does Sprockets Load an Asset? dec 20
A technical deep dive into sprockets.
Are You Load Balancing Wrong? dec 20
Anyone can use a load balancer. Using them properly is much more difficult.
Using Configurable Shared Examples in RSpec dec 21
Things get more complicated when you have the same behavior, but it has some slight variations for different contexts.
Front-End Performance Checklist 2017 (PDF, Apple Pages) dec 21
Some of the optimizations might be beyond the scope of your work or budget or might just be overkill given the legacy code you have to deal with.
Learning From A Year of Security Breaches dec 21
Responding to security incidents in 2016.
Story About Inesita, Ruby Frontend Framework dec 22
Learning from Lego: A Step Forward in Modular Web Design dec 22
When web components are modular like Lego bricks down to the elements level, they become more versatile and easier to maintain.
Safer Rails database migrations with Soundcloud's Large Hadron Migrator dec 23
If you need to migrate big tables without downtime in MySQL you can use LHM or upgrade MySQL to 5.6.
Ruby 2.4.0 Released dec 25
It is customary to release a new version of Ruby on Christmas.

item.title: Green Ruby News #202
item.content:encoded:
#202 - dec 18th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Residente
A great visual-musical exploration website.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Never again
Today we stand together to say: not on our watch, and never again.
Peekier
Another way to search the web, safely and visually.
Awesome NLP with Ruby
Resources, libraries, information sources about computational processing of texts in human languages with Ruby.
Text Emoticon Creator
The ultimate useless tool that you can't live without.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.4.0-rc1 Released dec 12
Features include hash table improvements, unifying fixnum and bignum, support for unicode mapping any many more.
Seeing Is Believing
Evaluates Ruby code, recording the results of each line.
Gitql
A git query language.
Sikuli Script
Uses image recognition to identify and control GUI components.
sidekiq-superworker
Directed acyclic graphs of Sidekiq jobs.
Enum_transitions
ActiveRecord::Enum transition validations.
Hyper
A terminal built on web technologies.
Database_flusher
Tiny and fast database cleaner.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Common Rails Security Pitfalls and Their Solutions dec 12
It’s important to understand common (and less common) security pitfalls that you may encounter.
How to make your Ruby code work on Windows PCs dec 12
Sometimes it is unavoidable.
Keeping Data in Sync with ActiveRecord::UpdatedAt dec 13
ActiveRecord does not touch updated_at by default when calling certain methods.
Prefer DEFER Over ASYNC dec 14
Frequently, I notice this blocking JavaScript is loaded with the ASYNC tag.
All the talks from Systems We Love dec 15
Details of the talks of the most interesting conference of the year.
Design Patterns in Ruby dec 17
Smmary of design patterns from the book Design Patterns in Ruby (by Russ Olsen)
20 Years of CSS dec 17
On December 17, 1996, W3C published the first standard for CSS.
Why three-tier support should be replaced with Swarming dec 17
The 3-tier support structure is ubiquitous in ITSM, but it is fundamentally at odds with DevOps principles. Swarming is a better answer.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Systems We Love (8h52) dec 13
20 systems, crazy high quality talks.

item.title: Green Ruby News #201
item.content:encoded:
#201 - dec 11th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Chinatown London
Clean layout with interesting effects.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
JavaScript 30
Build 30 things with vanilla JS in 30 days with 30 tutorials
bold.io
A lightweight editor for authentic writing.
Ansistrano
It's an Ansible port for Capistrano.
Disqus
A saas commenting system.
Buble
Fast ES2015 compiler.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Portainer
A web interface to manage docker containers.
Decider
Flexible and Extensible Machine Learning Ruby lib
Classifier
A general classifier module to allow Bayesian and other types of classifications.
Erlix
Ruby Interface of Erlang.
Github-changelog-generator
Automatically generate change log from tags, issues, labels and pull requests on GitHub.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
The half-life of code & the ship of Theseus dec 5
interesting research of how long a line of code lives.
Refactoring Ruby: DRY up your domain models using a struct table dec 5
It can be helpful to watch other programmers demonstrate the perspective changes that they’ve used to solve big problems.
9 New Features in Ruby 2.4 dec 6
It has become a tradition to release new Ruby versions on Christmas.
A Beginner's Guide to Exceptions in Ruby dec 6
People who know basic Ruby syntax but aren't really sure what an exception is or why it's useful.
Replacing Sinatra with Rack in Sidekiq dec 6
Making the transition from powering the Sidekiq Web UI with Sinatra to having it powered by a pure Rack app.
Building a new GitLab Docs site with Nanoc, GitLab CI, and GitLab Pages dec 7
How we built the new GitLab Docs portal from the ground up
The State of Babel dec 7
Current state of Babel, the powerful JavaScript tooling suite.
The Pure Functions experiment dec 9
Talk about pure functions and how they help to write better and maintainable code.

item.title: Green Ruby News #200
item.content:encoded:
#200 - dec 5th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Sequence
Creative digital agency in Cardiff and London UK. Cool effect on the home.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Crypto 101
Introductory course on cryptography, freely available for programmers of all skill levels.
CyberChef
Intuitive web app for analysing and decoding data without having to deal with complex tools or programming languages
Stamplay
Integrate APIs and automate tasks across on-premise, cloud apps and databases.
CSS Reference
A free visual guide to CSS

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ansible: Ruby on Rails Server (Ubuntu 16.x)
Use this ansible playbook to setup a fresh server.
Cyclotron
A web application for constructing dashboards.
wapiti-ruby
Fast Conditional Random Fields API for for sequence segmentation and labelling in Ruby.
Zeal
An offline documentation browser.
GitPlex
A featureful Git GUI.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
The European Ruby Revolution nov 27
While RailsConf is a huge thing in the US, there hasn’t been a European RailsConf since 2008.
Who Called Git? An Unusual Debugging Story nov 28
A lighter bug hunt story.
What’s the Second Job of a Startup CEO? nov 29
When startup CEOs start to scale their companies, they need to redefine themselves and their roles or risk stunting the potential of their startups.
How To Make A DSL, Hygienically nov 30
Domain Specific Languages (DSLs) are custom-made computer languages, designed to be convenient for specific tasks.
Loops in CSS Preprocessors dec 2
If you're not sure when to use loops in your code, keep an eye out for repetition.
DevRant: Appreciating Quality Geek Humor dec 2
LSometimes you just need to rant. Fortunately, there’s an app for that. It’s called devRant.
I wrote an address tokenizer using machine learning dec 2
A first step of machine learning by using CRF model for address parsing in Ruby.
Gem Release: Google Analytics Chrome Developer Cookie dec 3
Want to add easily configurable google analytics tracking code to your Rails application, but not register you and your development team’s clicks and views?
How to detect image contents from Ruby with Amazon Rekognition dec 4
Rekognition is a new Amazon Web Service that “makes it easy to add image analysis to your applications.”
How Font Awesome 5 Became Kickstarter’s Most Funded Software Project dec 4
Given the chance to go back in time, there are a few things we might do differently.

item.title: Green Ruby News #199
item.content:encoded:
#199 - nov 27th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Violent Shell
Web site in shell style.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Pinebook
A Low Cost Linux Laptop That Looks Like A MacBook.
Rails SQL Injection Examples
Things to prevent when taking pramams directly to your Rails query.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
CardsLib
Card evaluation is written in a functional way that allows, and is optimized for, lazy evaluation.
Stub_server
Boot up a real server to serve testing replies.
Dante2
A rewrite of dante editor built on top of DraftJs
Refinerycms
An extendable Ruby on Rails CMS that supports Rails 4.2+

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Ruby 2.3.3 Released nov 21
This release contains a bug fix about Refinements and Module#prepend.
Writing a Rails Feature - Blow by Blow nov 21
A detailed walkthrough on how a Rails core commiter implements a feature.
Style List Markers in CSS nov 21
The trick is to remove the list-style, then apply the markers through pseudo-element counters.
Ruby tips #2 nov 23
Interesting solutions which you’ll not find anywhere else.
Q&A With Piotr Solnica nov 23
Piotr, and developers like him, play the important role of breathing fresh air into our community.
The Double Splat Operator nov 24
It allows you to capture an indefinite number of named arguments or a hash right after capturing an array of arguments.
Random Interesting Facts on HTML/SVG usage nov 25
Interesting facts on markup usage.

item.title: Green Ruby News #198
item.content:encoded:
#198 - nov 20th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Bakken and Bæck
Digital studio website.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Nextcloud Box
Portable 1TB private cloud.
Webhook Tester
Test webhooks with your own unique test URL.
Kill the newsletter!
Make newsletters become RSS feeds.
Awesome-Hacking
A collection of various awesome lists for hackers, pentesters and security researchers

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.3.2 Released nov 15
This release contains update of RubyGems 2.5.2 and update of included ssl certificates along with other bug fixes.
wayback-machine-downloader
Download an entire website from the Wayback Machine.
whitewidow
SQL Vulnerability Scanner
envchain
Environment variables meet OS X Keychain and gnome-keyring.
Rocker
Rocker breaks the limits of Dockerfile.
Minio
Object storage server built for cloud application developers and devops

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Deploying Rails on Kubernetes nov 13
How to deploy and orchestrate a Rails 5 application with Kubernetes in Google Container Engine (GKE)
Statistical Literacy and You: An Intro for Programmers nov 14
Very seldom do we consider the ethical implications of how we are producing and showing that data.
A Rubyist's Guide to Big-O Notation nov 14
You would expect that processing an array of 100 items would be slower than an array of 10 items. But by how much?
Rack-App: A Performant and Pragmatic Web Microframework nov 14
Rack makes it incredibly easy for anyone with a basic grasp of TCP/IP to roll their own framework.
Replacing the Rails Asset Pipeline with Webpack and Yarn nov 15
Rails no longer needs to control the entire ecosystem, and arguably it shouldn’t because tools have been developed which do a better job.
Node.js Garbage Collection Explained nov 15
Learn how Node.js garbage collection and memory management works in practice. Code-level explanation and garbage collection examples inside.
Rails Database Best Practices nov 16
Reducing the number of queries, using indexes, or any of the other suggestions aren’t premature optimizations IMHO. It’s using your database correctly.
Adding and Leveraging a CDN on Your Website nov 16
If you’ve been working around web development for a while, you’ll know that the web has a need for speed.
15kb of CSS is all you’ll ever need nov 17
We have a CSS problem.
Native Browser Copy To Clipboard nov 18
It wasn't that long ago where you couldn't programmatically copy text to the clipboard from the web without using Flash.
Ruby Elixir Nodejs Tools Comparison Matrix nov 20
The toolboxes for different languages are quite similar.
